test_cases.name: E2E Pair-Wise Verification for a Single User Pair
preconditions: A properly formatted Excel file (.xlsx) with all required headers exists and is accessible.
Users 'user1@example.com' and 'user2@example.com' are pre-provisioned in the application.
Both users are members of the same company 'Innovate Inc' and the same huddle 'Alpha Team Huddle'.
Both users have permissions to create tasks and add priorities.
The application environment is stable and accessible at the specified base_url.
The test automation framework is configured to clear cookies after each logout.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the application URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter User1's email 'user1@example.com' from Excel and click Continue.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter User1's password 'pass123' from Excel and click Login.
test_steps.expected_result: User1 is successfully logged in and redirected to the company selection page.

test_steps.action: Select the company 'Innovate Inc' from Excel.
test_steps.expected_result: The application dashboard or main page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the Huddles menu to expand the dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown menu with a list of huddles is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the huddle 'Alpha Team Huddle' from Excel.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Alpha Team Huddle' page is loaded and displayed.

test_steps.action: Click 'Add Task' button and enter User1's TaskName 'Develop login feature' from Excel.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Click the calendar icon and select the DueDate '11/15/2025' from Excel.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected due date is populated in the date field.

test_steps.action: Click the Save button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task 'Develop login feature' is saved and appears in the 'Who What When' section for User1.

test_steps.action: Locate the 'Top Priority' input field in the 'My Updates' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Top Priority' field is visible and ready for input.

test_steps.action: Enter User1's TopPriority text 'Finalize API endpoints' from Excel into the field.
test_steps.expected_result: The text 'Finalize API endpoints' is entered into the field.

test_steps.action: Click outside the field to trigger the auto-save.
test_steps.expected_result: The top priority is auto-saved without any errors.

test_steps.action: Click the profile menu, select Sign Out.
test_steps.expected_result: User1 is successfully logged out and the login page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Repeat login steps 1-6 for User2 using email 'user2@example.com' and password 'pass456'.
test_steps.expected_result: User2 is successfully logged in and navigates to the 'Alpha Team Huddle' page.

test_steps.action: Verify User2 appears at the top of the members list.
test_steps.expected_result: User2's name is displayed at the top of the huddle members panel.

test_steps.action: Click on User1 in the members panel to view their updates.
test_steps.expected_result: The view switches to display User1's data.

test_steps.action: Verify User1's TaskName is displayed in the 'Who What When' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The task 'Develop login feature' with due date '11/15/2025' is visible.

test_steps.action: Verify User1's TopPriority is displayed in the 'My Updates' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The priority 'Finalize API endpoints' is visible.

test_steps.action: Click on User2 in the members panel to return to their own view.
test_steps.expected_result: The view switches back to User2's own page.

test_steps.action: Confirm the 'My Updates' section is visible for the current user.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Updates' section is visible, confirming it is User2's view.

test_steps.action: Repeat task creation steps 7-9 using User2's data: TaskName 'Test login feature', DueDate '11/16/2025'.
test_steps.expected_result: User2's task 'Test login feature' is created and displayed in their 'Who What When' section.

test_steps.action: Repeat priority creation steps 10-12 using User2's data: TopPriority 'Write E2E test cases'.
test_steps.expected_result: User2's priority 'Write E2E test cases' is saved and displayed in their 'My Updates' section.

test_steps.action: Click the profile menu and Sign Out.
test_steps.expected_result: User2 is successfully logged out and the login page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Repeat login steps 1-6 for User1.
test_steps.expected_result: User1 is successfully logged in and navigates to the 'Alpha Team Huddle' page.

test_steps.action: Click on User2 in the members panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The view switches to display User2's data.

test_steps.action: Verify User2's TaskName is visible in the 'Who What When' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The task 'Test login feature' with due date '11/16/2025' is visible.

test_steps.action: Verify User2's TopPriority is visible in the 'My Updates' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The priority 'Write E2E test cases' is visible.

test_steps.action: Click the profile menu and Sign Out.
test_steps.expected_result: User1 is successfully logged out and the login page is displayed.

test_cases.name: Successful Task Creation and Cross-User Visibility
preconditions: A properly formatted Excel file (.xlsx) with all required headers exists and is accessible.
Users 'user1@example.com' and 'user2@example.com' are pre-provisioned in the application.
Both users are members of the same company 'Innovate Inc' and the same huddle 'Alpha Team Huddle'.
Both users have permissions to create tasks.
The application environment is stable and accessible at the specified base_url.

test_steps.action: User1 logs in with email 'user1@example.com', selects company 'Innovate Inc', and navigates to the huddle 'Alpha Team Huddle'.
test_steps.expected_result: User1 is successfully on the 'Alpha Team Huddle' page.

test_steps.action: User1 clicks the 'Add Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation modal or input fields appear.

test_steps.action: User1 enters the TaskName 'Develop login feature' from the Excel file.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: User1 clicks the calendar icon and selects the DueDate '11/15/2025' from the Excel file.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected due date is populated in the date field.

test_steps.action: User1 clicks the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task 'Develop login feature' is saved and appears in User1's task list.

test_steps.action: User1 logs out.
test_steps.expected_result: User1 is successfully logged out and the login page is displayed.

test_steps.action: User2 logs in with email 'user2@example.com', selects the same company 'Innovate Inc', and navigates to the same huddle 'Alpha Team Huddle'.
test_steps.expected_result: User2 is successfully on the 'Alpha Team Huddle' page.

test_steps.action: User2 clicks on User1 in the members panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The view switches to display User1's data.

test_steps.action: User2 scrolls to the 'Who What When' section.
test_steps.expected_result: User1's task 'Develop login feature' with due date '11/15/2025' is visible and accurately displayed.

test_cases.name: Successful Priority Creation and Cross-User Visibility
preconditions: A properly formatted Excel file (.xlsx) with all required headers exists and is accessible.
Users 'user1@example.com' and 'user2@example.com' are pre-provisioned in the application.
Both users are members of the same company 'Innovate Inc' and the same huddle 'Alpha Team Huddle'.
Both users have permissions to add priorities.
The application environment is stable and accessible at the specified base_url.

test_steps.action: User1 logs in with email 'user1@example.com', selects company 'Innovate Inc', and navigates to the huddle 'Alpha Team Huddle'.
test_steps.expected_result: User1 is successfully on the 'Alpha Team Huddle' page.

test_steps.action: User1 scrolls to the 'My Updates' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Updates' section containing the 'Top Priority' field is visible.

test_steps.action: User1 clicks on the 'Top Priority' field to focus on it.
test_steps.expected_result: The cursor is active in the 'Top Priority' field.

test_steps.action: User1 enters the TopPriority text 'Finalize API endpoints' from the Excel file.
test_steps.expected_result: The text 'Finalize API endpoints' is entered into the field.

test_steps.action: User1 clicks another element on the page to shift focus and trigger the auto-save.
test_steps.expected_result: The priority is saved successfully via the auto-save mechanism.

test_steps.action: User1 logs out.
test_steps.expected_result: User1 is successfully logged out and the login page is displayed.

test_steps.action: User2 logs in with email 'user2@example.com', selects the same company 'Innovate Inc', and navigates to the same huddle 'Alpha Team Huddle'.
test_steps.expected_result: User2 is successfully on the 'Alpha Team Huddle' page.

test_steps.action: User2 clicks on User1 in the members panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The view switches to display User1's data.

test_steps.action: User2 scrolls to the 'My Updates' section.
test_steps.expected_result: User1's top priority 'Finalize API endpoints' is visible and accurately displayed.

test_cases.name: Data-Driven E2E Workflow for a Second User Pair
preconditions: An Excel file containing at least two valid user pairs exists and is accessible.
Users 'user3@example.com' and 'user4@example.com' are pre-provisioned in the application.
Both users are members of the same company 'Innovate Inc' and the same huddle 'Beta Team Huddle'.
Both users have permissions to create tasks and add priorities.
The application environment is stable and accessible at the specified base_url.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the application URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter User3's email 'user3@example.com' from Excel and click Continue.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter User3's password 'pass789' from Excel and click Login.
test_steps.expected_result: User3 is successfully logged in and redirected to the company selection page.

test_steps.action: Select the company 'Innovate Inc' from Excel.
test_steps.expected_result: The application dashboard or main page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the Huddles menu to expand the dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown menu with a list of huddles is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the huddle 'Beta Team Huddle' from Excel.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Beta Team Huddle' page is loaded and displayed.

test_steps.action: Click 'Add Task' button and enter User3's TaskName 'Design new dashboard' from Excel.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Click the calendar icon and select the DueDate '12/01/2025' from Excel.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected due date is populated in the date field.

test_steps.action: Click the Save button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task 'Design new dashboard' is saved and appears in the 'Who What When' section for User3.

test_steps.action: Locate the 'Top Priority' input field in the 'My Updates' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Top Priority' field is visible and ready for input.

test_steps.action: Enter User3's TopPriority text 'Create wireframes' from Excel into the field.
test_steps.expected_result: The text 'Create wireframes' is entered into the field.

test_steps.action: Click outside the field to trigger the auto-save.
test_steps.expected_result: The top priority is auto-saved without any errors.

test_steps.action: Click the profile menu, select Sign Out.
test_steps.expected_result: User3 is successfully logged out and the login page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Repeat login steps 1-6 for User4 using email 'user4@example.com' and password 'pass101'.
test_steps.expected_result: User4 is successfully logged in and navigates to the 'Beta Team Huddle' page.

test_steps.action: Verify User4 appears at the top of the members list.
test_steps.expected_result: User4's name is displayed at the top of the huddle members panel.

test_steps.action: Click on User3 in the members panel to view their updates.
test_steps.expected_result: The view switches to display User3's data.

test_steps.action: Verify User3's TaskName is displayed in the 'Who What When' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The task 'Design new dashboard' with due date '12/01/2025' is visible.

test_steps.action: Verify User3's TopPriority is displayed in the 'My Updates' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The priority 'Create wireframes' is visible.

test_steps.action: Click on User4 in the members panel to return to their own view.
test_steps.expected_result: The view switches back to User4's own page.

test_steps.action: Confirm the 'My Updates' section is visible for the current user.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Updates' section is visible, confirming it is User4's view.

test_steps.action: Repeat task creation steps 7-9 using User4's data: TaskName 'Review dashboard design', DueDate '12/02/2025'.
test_steps.expected_result: User4's task 'Review dashboard design' is created and displayed in their 'Who What When' section.

test_steps.action: Repeat priority creation steps 10-12 using User4's data: TopPriority 'Provide feedback on mockups'.
test_steps.expected_result: User4's priority 'Provide feedback on mockups' is saved and displayed in their 'My Updates' section.

test_steps.action: Click the profile menu and Sign Out.
test_steps.expected_result: User4 is successfully logged out and the login page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Repeat login steps 1-6 for User3.
test_steps.expected_result: User3 is successfully logged in and navigates to the 'Beta Team Huddle' page.

test_steps.action: Click on User4 in the members panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The view switches to display User4's data.

test_steps.action: Verify User4's TaskName is visible in the 'Who What When' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The task 'Review dashboard design' with due date '12/02/2025' is visible.

test_steps.action: Verify User4's TopPriority is visible in the 'My Updates' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The priority 'Provide feedback on mockups' is visible.

test_steps.action: Click the profile menu and Sign Out.
test_steps.expected_result: User3 is successfully logged out and the login page is displayed.

test_cases.name: Successful UI Navigation from Login to Huddle
preconditions: A properly formatted Excel file (.xlsx) with all required headers exists and is accessible.
User 'user1@example.com' is pre-provisioned in the application.
The user has access to company 'Innovate Inc' and huddle 'Alpha Team Huddle'.
The application environment is stable and accessible at the specified base_url.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the application URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid user email 'user1@example.com' from Excel and click Continue.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter the corresponding password 'pass123' from Excel and click Login.
test_steps.expected_result: Login is successful and the user is redirected to the company selection page.

test_steps.action: On the company selection page, locate and click the company name 'Innovate Inc' specified in the Excel file.
test_steps.expected_result: The company is selected and the user is taken to the main application dashboard.

test_steps.action: In the main navigation, locate and click the 'Huddles' menu to expand it.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown menu showing available huddles appears.

test_steps.action: From the dropdown, click the huddle name 'Alpha Team Huddle' specified in the Excel file.
test_steps.expected_result: The user successfully navigates to and lands on the 'Alpha Team Huddle' page.
